# Arpeggio: 6th in B (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation 
This arpeggio is a specific musical entity that involves playing the 6th in the key of B, using the A shape. It provides a unique sound and flavor to your music compositions and improvisations.

## Notes and Intervals
When using this arpeggio, you are essentially playing the notes in the B major scale along with its corresponding 6th (G# in this case), using the A shape on the guitar. The intervals played in this arpeggio are - 1 (root note B), 3 (D#), 5 (F#), and 6 (G#).

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is commonly used in various music genres, including jazz, blues, and rock. It adds a sophisticated and colorful flavor to your music, creating a distinct and melodic sound. The 6th interval brings a sense of resolution and musicality to your compositions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use this arpeggio:
1. "Europa" by Santana - Santana's iconic guitar solo in this song features the use of the 6th arpeggio in the key of B, adding smooth and elegant tones to the music.
2. "Little Wing" by Jimi Hendrix - Hendrix incorporates the 6th arpeggio in the key of B in his legendary guitar work in this song, showcasing its versatility and emotional depth.
3. "Sunny" by Bobby Hebb - This classic tune utilizes the 6th arpeggio in B to create a bright and uplifting atmosphere, highlighting the melodic beauty of this arpeggio shape.
